title: desouza420
author: desouza420
content: Hello guys If you had a free 500w /h what crypto will you be mining?i will install some solar power on my room and i calculate that i will have about 500w /h free and i intent to use these watts for miningwhat would be the best option for me?i am a newbie when comes to mining is monero or z cash still profitable? would an antminer x3 500w will be a good option for me?thank you in advance

comments.author: SuperSerb
comments.body: 8x6600 mining rig = 500 wats, 230 MH/s ETH mining.

comments.author: Lafu
comments.body: If you have the 500 W for free and dont have to pay for you can mine everything you want as all Coins you get with it is a plus for you ! But at the moment ETH Mining would be the best profit right now , til it will be changing to POS , but then you can also mine other Coins .If you have already the Asic just turn it on , if you thinking to buy one just for Mining if you are new dont do it , GPUs would be better and you can sell them laters again.

comments.author: rdluffy
comments.body: I don't know if you already have something to start, like a PC with free PCIe slots, but considering the moment of ETH POS, I suggest you to look for Nvidia cards.You can mine ETH right now and them you will have a better option to mine another coins, Nvidias are better than AMD on another algos.500w you can run 3x RTX 3070 for example, or 1x RTX 3080 and 1 RTX 3070, there's a lot of great combinationsRight now I don't think it's a good idea to go with AMDsIf you want more info about BTC mining and Asics, it's better to ask in: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?board=14.0

comments.author: philipma1957
comments.body: I would get a used L3+ down clock it to 300 mh which should be 500 watts.I would point it to viabtc and mine doge+ltc.https://www.ebay.com/itm/185457516877?the one above is an okay price I dont know seller.

comments.author: Z390
comments.body: If you have 500w per hour for free you cant use all that 500watt for mining, unless you have more than 500watt, I am thinking you are referring to solar energy, some times the sun won't be that bright, you won't be getting that exact 500watt from your panels. Also what about your backup? How will you charge if you use all available power.
